direction.raw_text: The quadrangle of Army buildings is quiet and deserted. A broken-down taxi drives in at one corner and slowly makes its way around the quadrangle. SUPERIMPOSED over shot is the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The taxi pulls up across the street from camera. A soldier gets out, pulls two heavily loaded barracks bags after him. He pays the driver, hoists the bags to his back, moves toward camera. The taxi drives away slowly. The soldier walks toward steps leading to a low building. He is PREWITT (called "PREW" for short), 22 years old, well-built, good-looking. He wears an enlisted man's uniform and on the sleeves are marks where chevrons have been removed. He pauses, looks up over the door. CAMERA PANS UP to sign which reads: ORDERLY ROOM - G COMPANY, 219TH REGIMENT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A small thin soldier in an undershirt and fatigue pants backs out of the screen door and into shot. He is wielding a frayed broom. This is PRIVATE ANGELO MAGGIO. He is violent and funny and sour and friendly. He sees Prewitt's legs but not his face, speaks as he sweeps a cloud of dust off the porch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine way to pass the time. Good for the mind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Maggio. Maggio turns and stares at Prew, astonished.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Prew...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I transferred out of Fort Shatter. Maggio notices the marks on the sleeves where the stripes have been removed. Prew follows his glance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You quit the Bugle Corps...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Prew nods. Maggio jerks his head toward the sign.

direction.raw_text: To here...?

direction.raw_text: You made a bad mistake. This outfit they can give back to Custer. Prew smiles slightly, starts toward door.

direction.raw_text: The Captain ain't in yet. Prew puts down his barracks bags.

direction.raw_text: I'll look around.

direction.raw_text: (smiles for first time) Maybe we borrow some money from a twenty per cent man and take a real trip to town some night.

direction.raw_text: Maybe.

direction.raw_text: ALONG COMPANY STREET Prew walks slowly down the raised porch alongside the street. He takes the mouthpiece of a bugle from his pocket, jiggles it idly, a habit of his. He comes to the Dayroom, glances through the screen door, goes in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Dayroom has a pool table, ping-pong table, a radio, etc. Moth-eaten, upholstered chairs line both walls. The place is empty as Prew enters. He looks around casually, sees the pool table in an alcove. He moves over to it, puts the bugle mouthpiece in his pocket, picks a cue from the rack on the wall. He switches on the light, chalks the cue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The triangle of balls is already racked on the table. Prew addresses the cue ball, shoots and breaks the rack solidly. He watches the balls hurry around the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O. S.) What're you think you're doing!? Why ain't you out in the field with the Compny? What's your name? The voice is brawling, brash, vigorous. Prew turns slowly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: WIDENS to INCLUDE FIRST SERGEANT MILTON WARDEN, almost at Prew's elbow. He is thirty-four, big and powerful, has a neatly-trimmed moustache.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Prewitt. Transfer from Shafter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. I heard about you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I heard about you, too, Warden.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, put up that cue and come along. This here's a rifle outfit, Prewitt. You ain't suppose to enjoy yourself before sundown. The Man's very particlar about little things like that. Warden goes out of the Dayroom. Prew puts up the cue and follows him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . COMPANY STREET TRUCKING SHOT as Prew and Warden walk along the porch, Warden a few paces ahead. They go into the Orderly Room.

direction.raw_text: a bespectacled, intellectual-looking Private First Class, is at the clerk's desk, opening it, taking out papers, etc. Prew sits on a bench as Warden goes over to Mazzioli.

direction.raw_text: Mazzioli! Grant went to the hospital yesterday. Did you make up his sick record? Did you make a note for the morning report?! You're the Compny Clerk. The lousy Sickbook is your job!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Those medics didn't get the Sickbook back till late yesterday -- I'll tend to it right now -- WARDEN Thanks. I already done it for you.

direction.raw_text: Maggio has swept his way over to Prew. He stops sweeping now, stares at the other man as if still incredulous.

direction.raw_text: But you the beat bugler they got over at Shatter. You probly the best on this whole Rock. In b.g., Warden has turned from Mazzioli and is looking at Prew. Prew looks back coolly, answers Maggio thoughtfully.

direction.raw_text: That's true. Maggio wags his head, bends over to pick up wastepaper basket.

direction.raw_text: Well, friend, I feel for you. But from my position I can't quite reach you.

direction.raw_text: Ten-sh-HUT! Prewitt, Mazzioli and Maggio spring to attention. The screen door bangs and CAPTAIN DANA HOLMES enters shot. He wears cavalry boots and spurs. He is about forty, unsure of himself, therefore always too certain with his men. He nods pleasantly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At ease. Good morning, men. Anything special this morning, Sergeant Warden? I've only a few minutes.

direction.raw_text: New man here, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, yes. Bring him in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Holmes goes into his office. Warden jerks his thumb toward the door. Prewitt goes into the office. Warden follows him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holmes is seated at his desk as Prewitt and Warden enter. A placard on it reads: CAPTAIN HOLMES. A smaller desk nearby has a placard' reading: 1ST SERGEANT WARDEN. Warden seats himself at this desk. On the walls are framed photographs of prizefighters as well as one of a large golden trophy. On Holmes' desk is a small framed photograph of a very attractive blonde woman. Prewitt comes to attention in front of Holmes' desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir, Private Robert E. Lee Prewitt reporting to the Compny Commander as ordered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At ease. (takes papers out of drawer, glances through
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They sent your service record over... Twenty-two years of age... born in Kentucky... enlisted first at Fort Myer, Virginia... Bugle Corps... re-enlisted for overseas duty... Fort Shafter... First Bugler... (BENIGNLY) Prewitt, I always make it a policy to talk to my new men. It's important for an officer and his men to understand each other. Now I have a fine smooth-running outfit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: FEATURING WARDEN Holmes cannot see Warden who is grinning at Prewitt with unholy glee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Plenty of room for advancement for a man who knows how to soldier. But he's got to show me he's got it on the ball. I don't know what you've been used to in the Bugle Corps, but in my outfit we run it by the book. What kind of trouble were you in over there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No trouble, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What made you transfer out, then?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a personal matter, air.

direction.raw_text: Oh. I see... He studies Prew for a moment, sees Warden on the edge of his chair, watching hawk-like.

direction.raw_text: Something you wanted to ask, Sergeant?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who? Me? Whv, yes, air. You had Corpral's stripes in the Bugle Corps, Prewitt. You took a bust to buck Private to transfer to an Infantry Compny. Why? Because you like to hike?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I dint have no trouble if that's what you mean.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or was it just because you couldn't stand to bugle?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was a personal matter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's up to the Compny Commander's discretion to decide.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (looks straight at Warden) All right. I was First Bugler at Shafter for two years. The topkick had a friend who transferred in from the states. Next day he made him First Bugler over me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you asked out on account of that!?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe I just ain't sensible... But that's the reason.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His feelings were hurt! Kids they send us now! Warden swings his chair around, absorbs himself in work at his desk as if the Prew situation is too absurd to concern himself with. Holmes speaks blandly, winningly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got a mighty sour Company Bugler here... but I suppose you wouldn't want that job.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, we'll get your stripes back for you, maybe an extra one for good measure. You know why you were sent over here when you requested transfer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I pulled a few strings. I'm the Regimental Boxing Coach, Prewitt. I saw your fight with Connors in the Bowl year before last. With any luck you should have won it. I thought for a while, in the second round, you were going to knock him out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: HOLMES
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My Regiment got beaten last year in the finals, as you know. (SAVAGE INSISTENCE) But I mean to win this year. And I will. All I've needed was a top middleweight. (waves at pictures) Next year I'll hang your picture up there with the others, my boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: FEATURING PREW PREW I'm sorry, air. But I quit fighting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Quit fighting? When? What for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just stopped, sir... After -- Maybe you heard about what happened...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean that fallow you hurt -- the one that went blind?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PREW Prew's lips are drawn tight. He nods almost imperceptibly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: During this shot Maggio can be seen in b.g. through door to Orderly Room. He pretends to be sweeping, but stops now and then to listen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, it's too bad about that. I can understand how you feel. But those things happen in this game. A man has got to accept that possibility when he fights.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's why I decided I would quit, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But on the other hand, look at (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: it this way. What if all fighters felt like that?

direction.raw_text: They don't.

direction.raw_text: Would you have us disband our fighting program because one man got hurt?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, sir. I dint say -- HOLMES You might as well say stop war because one man got killed. Our fighting program is the best morale builder we have off here away from home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want it disbanded, sir. (DOGGEDLY) But I don't see why any man should fight unless he wants to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It looks to me like you're trying to acquire a reputation as a lone wolf, Prewitt. You should know that in the Army it's not the individual that counts. If a man wants to get ahead he has certain responsibilities to fulfill that go beyond the regulations. It might look as though I were a free agent, but I'm not. Nobody is. Holmes waits hopefully for a moment, then realizes Prew is not going to respond further. He stands. Prew snaps to attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe you'll change your mind. In the meantime just don't make any mistakes in my outfit. (TO WARDEN) I've got to go into town. Is there anything else for me today, Sergeant?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (holds up papers) Yea, sir! The Compny Pond Report's got to be made out. It's due
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You make it out. Is that all?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (holds up more papers) No, sir!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, whatever it is, you fix it. If there's anything that has to go in this afternoon, sign my name. I won't be back. He goes out, crossing Warden's desk and knocking a wire basket filled with papers on the floor. In a moment, the sound of the screen door slamming is heard. Warden picks up the papers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He'd strangle on his own spit if I weren't here to swab out his throat for him. (TO PREW) Come on. I'll show you the Supply Room. Warden goes out to Orderly Room, Prew following.

direction.raw_text: as Prew and Warden enter and walk through. Maggio bobs his head approvingly at Prew.

direction.raw_text: When you turned down Dynanite Holmes' boxing squad? You put your head in a noose. Things are soft for a boxer in his Compny. Otherwise, you better know how to soljer.

direction.raw_text: I'll take my chances. A convertible, top down, drives by and pulls up outside the Orderly Room. KAREN HOLMES, a tall, lean blonde woman, gets out. Her skirt hikes up a little as she goes up the stairs to the Orderly Room. Warden and Prew stop walking and watch her. Karen stops, glances at Warden momentarily, then goes into the Orderly Room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Since when is this place gettin to be the Royal Hawaiian?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's she?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His wife. Captain Holmes'. They resume walking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll fight, Prewitt. You'll fight because Captain Holmes got a bee in his hat he needs a winnin team to make Mayor. And if you don't do it for him you'll do it for me. I only been in this outfit eight months myself but I learned one thing. My job is to keep him happy. The more he's happy the less he bothers me and the better I run his Compny. So we know where we stand, don't we, kid?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know where I stand. I don't believe that's the only way a man can get along. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A man's got to make up his own mind and go his own way. It he don't, he's nothin...

direction.raw_text: Maybe back in the days of the pioneers a man could go his own way. But not in our time, kid. Today you got to play ball. You got to divide it all by two. They have reached a Dutch door, top half open. A sign over it reads: SUPPLY ROOM.

result.heading: INTO SUPPLY ROOM SUPPLY SERGEANT LEVA

direction.raw_text: SHOOTING INTO SUPPLY ROOM SUPPLY SERGEANT LEVA is eating a candy bar with one hand and leisurely typing up a form with the other. He is a foolish- looking man, about thirty-five.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lava! Can't I once walk by this Supply Room and find you workin with both hands!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (comes up to door) I can't do no better on what you people pay me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Draw some supplies for this man. (TO PREW) That's G Compny barracks over there. Get rid of your bags and come back here, and Leva'll find you a cart to lug your stuff over in. Save you makin four five trips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (surprised, pleased) Okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just hate to see energy wasted. Any kind. Besides, you'll be needin yours. Prew walks off, toting the barracks bags. The bang of the Orderly Room door is heard and Lava and Warden look in that direction.

direction.raw_text: You heard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, never me. But a lot of them. I know some of the Use she played 'around with, don't tell me.

direction.raw_text: Good morning, Sergeant.

direction.raw_text: I'm looking for my husband.

direction.raw_text: Captain Holmes just went in town, ma'am.

direction.raw_text: Oh. Of course, He was to have left some things for me. (STUMBLES SLIGHTLY) That he was to have purchased. Do you know anything about them?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, ma'am, I don't. Is there anythin I can do for you?

direction.raw_text: . No, thanks, Sergeant. She makes slight move to go, pauses.

direction.raw_text: He's been telling me quite a bit about you lately. My husband. He says you're very efficient.

direction.raw_text: Yes, ma'am.

direction.raw_text: What is it that makes you so efficient, Sergeant?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I couldn't help it if I was born smart, ma'am. Karen laughs suddenly, loudly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love that. Well, good-bye, Sergeant. Karen turns and walks back up the porch toward her car. Warden and Leva watch her. When she is out of earshot Leva speaks.

direction.raw_text: But man, she sure is one, ain't she?

direction.raw_text: One what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One woman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've seen better.

direction.raw_text: 22 Karen, in a negligee, is seated at a dressing table, brushing her hair -- steadily, gracefully, enjoying the sensual pleasure of it. Karen is a woman of moods and tempers, spontaneous, quick to impulse. A car is heard pulling up in the driveway, the motor stopping. Karen's brush strokes become faster, rougher. The front door is heard opening and Holmes' voice calling, "Karen." She does not answer. Holmes enters. He seems to have had a few drinks. Through the following, Karen continues brushing her hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry I'm so late. And about dinner, I -- KAREN It doesn't matter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got tied up with General Slater. Bumped into him at the Officers' Club.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes? What did the General have to say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Success, he said. Success in war, success in peacetime... And not a word about my promotion... There are times I think the Old Man's just waiting to ship me down... (slumps into chair) I've had a bad day all around... (MORE)

direction.raw_text: started right off this morning... trouble with a new man...

direction.raw_text: If you'd spend less time buttering Generals and more time with your Company, maybe you'd get that promotion.

direction.raw_text: I went over there this morning looking for you.

direction.raw_text: I had some business to attend to in town. During the afternoon.

direction.raw_text: Now what does that mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dana. Give me credit for a few brains.

direction.raw_text: How many, times do I have to tell you I haven't any other women before you'll believe me?

result.heading: SHOOTING INTO MIRROR ON DRESSING TABLE

direction.raw_text: KAREN SHOOTING INTO MIRROR ON DRESSING TABLE Karen laughs sharply, loudly, then stops suddenly as she looks at herself in the mirror, sees the repugnance in her face. She puts down the hairbrush, picks up a long comb.

direction.raw_text: If it were so, don't you think I'd admit it? The way things are between us now? What right have you to always be accusing me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What right?

direction.raw_text: 17. They are both tense now. Holmes is out of the chair and pacing. Karen combs her hair spasmodically.

direction.raw_text: That again. How long will it be, I wonder, before I'm allowed to live that down? After eight years, how many times do I have to tell you It Was An Accident?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That makes it all right, I suppose!

direction.raw_text: I didn't say that. I know what it's done to you, but -- KAREN You know I hate to talk about it! He moves over to her.

direction.raw_text: How many times do I have to tell you I'm sorry, about that? How many times that I had no way of knowing - He puts his hands on her shoulders. Karen shakes away, rises, faces him.

direction.raw_text: You had a way of knowing, Dana. I want to go to bed. Please get out of my bedroom. Holmes looks at her sullenly, then exits to adjoining room, closing the door behind him. There is a moment of silence, then a sharp snap as Karen breaks the comb in two.

direction.raw_text: WARDEN The room is fairly well filled with soldiers. The click of pool balls is heard over shot. Warden is reading a newspaper.. A column heading, conspicuous in shot, reads:

direction.raw_text: AT POOL TABLE Maggio, Prew and CHIEF CHOATE, a Corporal, are playing pool. Choate is a full Choctaw Indian, a man of great bulk and tolerance. He speaks in a tremendously deep bass voice. The
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . table on one side is surrounded by the prizefighters of G Company. They are IRE GALOVITCH, an ape-like, bent-kneed man weighing about two twenty, with a widow's peak almost to his eyebrows; BALDY DHOM, chunky and tough, his head as bald as an orange; TURP THORNHILL, a stringy, chinless Mississipian;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a tall, hard Texan; CHAMP WILSON, wiry and good- looking. They are all Sergeants except Wilson, who is a Corporal. The men have been heckling Prew and are watching with cold belligerence. Choate, bending over his cue, shoots and misses.

direction.raw_text: I'm coldern a Idaho winter tonight. Prew shoots, makes a brilliant shot.

direction.raw_text: Man, what I would not give to have this character in the corner poolroom in my home town: I'd dress him up on overhalls and a straw hat and put a grass in his teeth, and I would make a whole mint of ghelt off him! Choate laughs deeply. Prew sizes up a new shot.

direction.raw_text: You might as well get use to it, kid. You probly be seein it often before you die.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PREW AND CHOATE In b.g. a few of the men are moving to and from the latrine but most of them are in their bunks. Over shot the sound of a bugle blowing Tattoo is heard. Lights are being extinguished in various parts of the room. Prew and Choate are lying on adjoining bunks, smoking. Choate's voice is almost linked to his last speech of preceding scene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... oh, sure, we got a few bad non- coms and we got Dynamite Holmes for a Captain. But I been around twenty years in this Army. They even up. In b. g. Warden and SERGEANT PETE (POP) KARELSEN come through from the latrine. The latter is a grizzled, crumbled dog- face, about fifty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take A Compny. They got the best Compny Commander I ever saw. But their Topkick -- he ain't no Warden. Warden stops beside Prew and Karelsen moves on, going in to a small room off the main squadroom. Warden's big, powerful body is covered only by a towel around his loins. He smiles at Prew.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, kid. Everythin nice and comfy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never better.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'at's the lull before the storm, kid. Set yourself. He moves off, goes into the room he shares with Karelsen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the deal with him, anyway? I can't figure him. The lights are almost all off and activity in the room has ended.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Warden? He's a wild man. He was in the 15th when they seen their action in the Settlement in Shanghai. I heard about it down in the Philippes even. He got himself a DSC and a Purple Heart out of it but you'd never know it if I dint tell you. This next war comes, Warden'll be right in there, standin up on the skyline, trio to get himself killed, but nothing will ever touch him. He'll come through maddern, wildern, craziern ever. All I know is he's the best soljer I ever saw... The lights are all out now and the room is in darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PLATOON OF MEN carrying rifles, marching at attention. Prew is FEATURED in shot; a light smile of pleasure as he moves along. Choate, bringing up the rear, is singing the Regimental Marching Song in a wonderful basso. Dhom marches on one side of the platoon, Galovitch on the other. Dhom calls out the "huts."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: FEET OF MEN MARCHING They are in perfect unison.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: TRUCKING SHOT PREW DHOM'S VOICE Prewitt! Get in step, Prewitt! Prew frowns slightly. He hops once, changing stride, realizes he is now out of step.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Prewitt! Dis a drill, not picnic! Get in step!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Prew hops again, changing step. He marches along. Dhom's voice commands "Platoon -- Halt!" Prew and men around him come to halt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PLATOON
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Prewitt! Step out! Prew steps to the front, still smiling faintly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You march like a drunk gooney bird! Corpral Paluso! Take this man to the track. Send him 'round seven laps double-time rifle at high port!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Prew running around track, his rifle at high port. He wears a slightly contemptuous smile. CORPORAL PALUSO sits on the grass infield watching him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: THE PLATOON kneeling over their rifles, laid out on shelter halves. Prew is FEATURED in shot. His shirt is wet and he is sweating heavily, as if he has just come from the run around the track. Henderson stands in front of the group, instructing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: rifle's your beat friend. In case them weapons jams in combat could mean life or death. You got to know 'em inside out. Now I want you to strip them weapons and put it together again. (holds up stop watch) Go! The men start taking their rifles apart as fast as they can. Henderson walks around watching them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PREW AND MAGGIO stripping rifles. Prew is efficient and brilliantly fast, Maggio fumbling and slow. Maggio keeps looking over at Prew, admiring his speed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PREW as he strips the rifle. (This mechanical operation should be interesting to audiences; a good man can field strip the weapon in thirty or forty seconds.) Prew finishes the job and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: to CLOSE on shelter half where all the parts are laid out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'at's fair time. Now lemma see you put it together. Prew's hands start to work over rifle parts, putting them together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: THE RIFLE in Prew's hands, assembled, CAMERA PULLS BACK as Prew stands up, holding the weapon. The rest of the men are still working over their rifles, Maggio is staring up at Prew in awe. Henderson grabs the rifle from Prew, turns his back to him, pretending to squint along barrel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: HENDERSON looking along barrel. SHOT FEATURES his thumb as he flips the rear sight to one side. Henderson turns around and ANGLE WIDENS to include Prew. He throws the rifle at Prew, who catches it, staggering back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your rear sight's way off! You'd be fifty feet off your target at three hundred yards! (to others, mockingly) That's what comes when a soljer don't know how to assemble a rifle. (TO PREW) You better get down to the track and carry it around a few times. Maybe that'll teach you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PREW running around track to sun, rifle held before him. The smile is fainter but still there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: BAYONET PRACTICE The platoon is divided into teams of two. Thornhill is the instructor. This is actual hand-to-hand training. Prew wields his rifle, bayonet fixed, in expert thrusts. Maggio is fighting in next lane. Thornhill walks behind Prew, trips him quickly as he passes. Prew falls off balance. His opponent smashes his rifle against Prew's, knocks it to the ground. Prew whirls on Thornhill in protest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wide open, ey, Prewitt? Maybe seven laps'll teach you to watch yourself... Maggio, wielding his rifle madly, yells over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, I saw that -- I saw what you
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PREW AND MAGGIO toiling around track together, holding rifles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: OUTSIDE SUPPLY ROOM Maggio and Prew trudge wearily along the porch, rifles on shoulders. Their sweaty uniforms are plastered to their bodies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I use to think a shipping clerk was a dog's life. (sighs, shakes head) What I would not give to be back in Gimbel's basement! As they come up to the Supply Room, Warden, neat and cool, is leaning on the counter. He steps aside to let them pass, beams at Prew.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chow's almost over, men. Better hurry up and wash. `less of course you'd rather go in the way you are.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Maggio gives Warden a dirty look. Prew's expression is noncommittal. They carry their rifles into the Supply Room. Leva comes up to the door as Warden turns to go back to the Orderly Room. As he does, Karen's convertible comes down the street. Warden stops, watches it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Karen drives by, turning her head slightly toward Warden. There is the vaguest trace of i smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: FEATURING WARDEN as he turns to watch the departing car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm tellin you, Top, she's trouble. You better keep your mind off what you're thinkin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of Warden, still looking after the car, thinking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: WARDEN AND HOLMES It is a gloomy, rainy day and the lights are on in the office. Warden is at his desk, working. Holmes is buckling on his trench coat. He wears a happy smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I won't be back in time to take Retreat. (winks at Warden) Or Reveille either, probably.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (strides back and forth;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All work and no play, Sergeant. All you do is sit around sweating over this paper and that. There are other things in this world beside work. Warden carries some official papers to Holmes' desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (bending over, tying
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You ought to get out more yourself, Warden. Warden is looking directly at the picture of Karen on Holmes' desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been considering it. He turns aside as Holmes straightens up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I'm going. He claps Warden on the back fraternally.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm leaving it in your care, Sergeant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It'll be here when you get back. Holmes goes out. Warden turns back to Holmes' desk. He is still holding the papers in one hand. He looks at Karen's picture, picks it up with his other hand, squints at it, considering the chances very, very carefully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: WARDEN standing on the open porch, in the rain. He wears a GI raincoat. He is squinting at the door with the same expression he used looking at Karen's picture. He takes a deep breath as if he were going off a high diving board, then knocks briskly. A shadow moves across the room behind the curtains. Then Karen opens the door. She is in shorts and a blouse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. If it isn't Sergeant Warden. You better step inside or you'll get wet. Warden opens the screen door and jumps in past the water running off the eaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SMALL PANTRY OFF KITCHEN - DAY MEDIUM SHOT as Warden jumps in. He takes off his rain hat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am wet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you're looking for my husband, he isn't here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (taking the long chance) And if I'm not looking for him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He still isn't here. If that does you any good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I'm looking for him. Do you know where he is?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I haven't the slightest idea. Perhaps he's in town. I guess it was `in town' the way you put it, wasn't it? Or perhaps he's at the Club. Having a drink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (fishes in his pocket, brings out papers) I got some papers it's important for him to sign. Today.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll try phoning him at the Club for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never like to disturb a man drinking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it you want, Sergeant?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I could use a drink myself right now. Bad. Anyway, I got a faint suspicion the Captain's `in town.' Ain't you going to ask me in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Karen finally smiles, faintly. She goes into the kitchen, leaving the door open. Warden follows her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The kitchen is small and undistinguished. Karen takes a whisky bottle from a cabinet, pours a straight, stiff drink, puts it on the sink. Warden puts the papers down and drinks. Karen sits on a high kitchen stool.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're taking an awful chance, you know. My maid is liable to be home any time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No she won't. Thursday's her day off. He takes off his raincoat, drops it on a chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think of everything, don't you, Sergeant?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I try. In my position you have to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (goes to sink, picks up
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are these really important?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. But not important they get signed today. Tomorrow's okay. Karen suddenly, deliberately, rips the papers in half. Then she tears them into bits and throws them into the wastebasket. Warden appreciates the gesture, relaxes for the first time. He grins widely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got carbons of those back at the office. So it won't be much work to fix them up. Warden's control has begun to affect Karen's now. She is losing her poise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what I like about you, Sergeant. You have confidence. It's also what I dislike about you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not confidence. It's honesty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Honesty? How did you acquire such an old-fashioned virtue?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I figgered out one day it was the shortest distance between two points.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, he's clever as well as virile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No -- it's just that I hate to see a beautiful woman goin all to waste. He moves close to Karen, is on the verge of embracing her. Greatly tempted but greatly disturbed, she turns away. During next she pours herself a drink, the bottle shaking in her hand. Her tone is no longer brittle. It is bitter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Waste, did you say? Now that's a subject I might tell you something about. There's we. And then there's waste. Positive and negative. The negative is sometimes more interesting... more evil. For example -- what about the house without a child? Tell me your thoughts, Sergeant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're going to cry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not if I can help it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please don't cry... I can't stand to see somebody cry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Karen turns to face him as he picks up his raincoat, is about to put it on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm leaving. Isn't that what you want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know, Sergeant. To be honest, I don't know. They stare squarely at each other, both puzzled and a little afraid of their emotions. This is something neither had counted on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know a beach near Diamond Head. Nobody ever goes there. The cars on the highway pass above and they never know it's there. You feel like you used to feel when you were a kid, hiding by yourself in a cave, watching the others hunting you. Karen turns, goes to the sink, puts the whisky bottle back in the cabinet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe... why not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How about Payday? Karen is trying hard to regain her glassy composure. She is unsmiling again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't have to spend money on me, Sergeant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just like to have some on me when I take out a woman. Can you get away?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Warden grins as he puts on his raincoat. He goes to the door to the pantry, pauses there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be in Kuhio Park. Say, nine o'clock. Payday. Karen leans back against the sink, watches him go out to the pantry. A moment later the sound of the door is heard as he leaves the house. She turns on the faucet, starts to rinse, the glasses they have used. Suddenly she turns the faucet on full force, watches it pound into the sink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: HOLMES GALOVITCH THORNHILL WILSON DHOM HENDERSON The men are grouped around Holmes. He is pressing hard to pretend equanimity. The Sergeants appear somewhat baffled but determined.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: this man Prewitt's been here over a month now. I expected you mend have him around before this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've been runnin him pretty hard. But he don't faze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe he needs a good dose of The Treatment. The men react to the phrase; The Treatment is obviously reserved for very special, intractable cases. They consider it silently for a moment or two.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A double dose needs him to be given.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Treatment'll bring that puppy boy around...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You understand. I don't want any rough stuff. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But we all know good athletes make good leaders. And good leaders -- The music of the forthcoming MONTAGE drowns Holmes' words as he continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The MONTAGE consists of a continuous stream of SUPERIMPOSURES depicting Prew's growing humiliation and exhaustion at the hands of the non-corns. Mingling with the background shots are VARIOUS ANGLES of CLOSEUPS of Prew. As the speed of the sequence increases, the stubborn smile on his face gives way to hurt, bitterness, anger... Over shots we occasionally hear stray shouts of the non-corns as they belabor Prew, but for the most part these and other dialogue are obliterated by
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The MONTAGE can be selected and created from the
direction.name: direction

FIRING RANGE, PATROL EXERCISES, GRENADE PRACTICE, (IF NEEDED)

direction.raw_text: S OF PRECEDING TRAINING SEQUENCES FLASHES ADDITIONAL TRAINING SITUATIONS -- E.G. FIRING RANGE, PATROL EXERCISES, GRENADE PRACTICE (IF NEEDED) in all of which Prew excels.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: riding Prew, mocking him, grinning at him, thumbing him to the track, etc. FEATURED is Galovitch, who takes particular Joy in baiting Prew.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: running around track, staggering despite a tremendous effort not to show his fatigue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: with the platoon going through, crouched low, live ammunition spattering around them. Prew, nearest camera, is lower than any man in the line. Over shot we hear a snatch of Wilson's Voice yelling at Prew to get lower.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: FLASHES GALOVITCH WILSON DHOM THORNHILL HENDERSON

direction.raw_text: FLASH WILSON AND PREW Wilson bawling Prew out, thumbing him to one side of obstacle course.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: chinning himself on bar setup near obstacle course; he is near physical exhaustion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: going through alone, on his belly in deep mud.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PREW (CULMINATION OF SUPERIMPOSED CLOSEUPS AND END OF MONTAGE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . coming HEAD-ON into camera as he bellies through the mud of the obstacle course. Snatch of mingled voices of non-coms yelling "Keep it downs", "Get that nose in the mud!", etc. Prew is utterly spent. His face drops into the mud, which splatters up, obscuring the screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: SWIRLING DISHWATER IN SINK MEDIUM SHOT PREW bent over the sink, scraping, washing and rinsing cooking pans and mixing basins. He hangs the soap bucket on the hot faucet and turns it on full force. As he does, PRIVATE WILLARD, a fat, whining cook, dumps an additional huge pile of pans before him. Prew looks at them ruefully. Willard says something to him with a "hustle up" gesture. The faucet drowns the words.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: PART OF KITCHEN PREW AT SINK IN B

direction.raw_text: ANOTHER PART OF KITCHEN PREW AT SINK IN B.G. Men are working in the steady, helpless motion of the KP. Waiters swing in and out of the entrances leading to the mess halls, carrying large trays.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: SERGEANT STARK The Mesa Sergeant, a tall, gaunt man, surveys the scene possessively. Maggio, Dining Room Orderly today, wearing a soiled white coat, flashes by to the mess hall, almost dropping his loaded tray in his haste.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PRIVATE TREADWELL A slow, lazy, heavy man, peeling potatoes. There is a large kettle filled with dirty water in front of him in which the potatoes are floating. Treadwell stabs at one with a long fork, misses it. He stabs again, almost in slow motion, misses again. He sees Stark glowering over him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah+m suppose to be a automatic rifle man, not a spud-cutter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rifle man, huh? All somebody'd have to do would be holler war at you and it'd be over the hill and far away. Stark walks off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... they just give me my chance they'll see... He is surprised and pleased as he spears a potato this time. He raises it triumphantly like a caught fish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PREW AND WILLARD The faucet is still on and we cannot hear what Willard says as he dumps more pans before Prew. However, he is obviously complaining that Prew is slow. Prew, sweating and angry, barks something back at him and turns the faucet off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No cook ever used that many panel Not even for an officers, banquet, ladies invited! Want me to grow couple more arms?! Stark, always alert to trouble, comes into shot. Willard sees him and speaks with whining dignity, for Stark's benefit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All I ask is that you keep the pans washed up so they're clean when I need them. In order that I am allowed to cook the kind of food required for men who work hard all day and who need good nourishing food to get their nourishment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hole up 'at noise. This man's hot as a forty-five shootin downhill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How you think I can do my job if the Mess Sergeant takes sides with a goldbricking KP? What do you think I am?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you're a fat cook who can't cook. As Willard retires, Maggio pours through from the mass hall. Screaming joyously, he shoves two empty platters in front of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Comin through! Comin through! Me and my table waiters! (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We workin our tail off. They runnin us to death. Hot stuff! Comin through hot stuff one side! Nobody pays any attention but Prew, who smiles at him. Maggio winks back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Prew! Bettern being threwn in jail, ain't it? Maggio passes camera, leaving the shot and disclosing Warden, who has entered from the mess hall in his wake. He carries a dish of eggs and sausage and is leaning against a pastry table. He is grinning lovingly toward Prew. He strolls over to Prew. He eats through following. The smile never leaves his face, broadens as the scene progresses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You look awful tard, kid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PREW working over the sink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you like straight duty?. Life in a rifle compny, eh? Prew stops working, turns toward Warden.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What makes you think I mind it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: FEATURING KP'S, STARK, MAGGIO, WILLARD, TREADWELL as something electric transmits itself and they all stop what they are doing to look over toward Prew and Warden.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't say you minded it, kid. I just said you looked tard. Drawn to a fine edge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't mind it, Top. It's a great life, this. I find a pearl, I'll cut you in. Fifty-fifty, If you hadn't put me here, I wouldn't have had no chance to find it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: WARDEN AND PREW 36.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, well, there's a man for you. I'll see if I can fix you up with a lot more since you like it so much. How you like the garbage detail?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks, Top, I've had it. You give it to me Tuesday. Remember?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (nods, as if just
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, then, how 'bout street cleaning detail?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That, too. Yesterday.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got a better memory than me. Guess the best thing to do is leave you right in the kitchen a while, huh? He pretends to turn away, then stops, turns back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Course if you was an ath-a-leet you wouldn't have to pull KP. Or any fatigue duty for that matter...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (not smiling now) If you think you can push me into fightin, Warden, you're wrong. Not you and Dynamite and The Treatment. I'm twice the man you are. If you dint have them stripes I'd take you out on the green and beat you to a pulp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smile growing bigger) Don't let the stripes worry you, kid. I can always take my shirt off. Take it off right now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'd like that. You could get me a year in the Stockade for that one, couldn't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PREW'S HAND closing around a heavy mug in the sink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PREW AND WARDEN Warden looking at Prew's hand. Warden's grin broadens with something more than sarcasm. He is 'impressed and pleased by Prew's honest anger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't throw it, Prewitt. It might break on my head. And that would cost you one thin dime next Payday. Warden deliberately turns his back and walks off. Prew looks after him. CAMERA MOVES IN to FEATURE his hand on the mug. He grasps it tighter, then lets it fall back into the soapy water,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PRIVATE FRIDAY CLARK He is blowing the bugle, sounding Pay Call. The rays of a blinding sun flash on its shiny surface.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bugle is heard over shot. A line of spruced-up men stretches through the mess hall. A blanket is spread over a table and behind it sits Holmes, flanked by Warden and Mazzioli. In front of Holmes is a pile of greenbacks and a cigar box filled with silver. He is paying out the man at the head of the line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and just see you don't drink all this up in one place. The man smiles, appreciating the whimsy, salutes, moves off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Prewitt. Prew, next in line, steps up to the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Robert E. Lee, RA 345071. He is crisp, sharp, expressionless. He holds out his hands for fingernail inspection.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Holmes looks them over, then up at the perfect knot in his tie. He stares at Prew as if trying to fathom him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you given any thought to the boxing team recently, Prewitt?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I feel the same way, sir. Holmes' hands clench. He seems about to fly into a rage when he senses a motion at his side. He turns to see Warden looking straight at him. Warden's face has the same meaningfully expressionless look as Prew's. Holmes wilts before it, turns to Mazzioli.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's this man's pay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (reading from Payroll) Private Prewitt, thirty dollars base pay. Deductions-laundry, insurance, PX checks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: to CLOSE SHOT of Holmes# hands laying money out on blanket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Total due twelve dollars thirty cents.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Payday night. A gay, noisy jamboree. Soldiers, mostly in civilian clothes, and uniformed sailors swarm down the street. Taxi drivers arguing with their fares as they pull up at bars. Filipinos padding in twos and threes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: AT ENTRANCE Maggio and Prew, dressed in slacks and Aloha shirts, stand in front of what looks like a renovated residence. They give evidence of having already accomplished a little substantial drinking. The sound of loud piano playing is heard from within. A sign over the door reads: NEW CONGRESS CLUB - SOFT DRINKS - DANCING - RECREATION - MEMBERS ONLY. The door opens
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . and MRS. KIPFER stands at the threshold. She is a sophisticated-looking woman with upswept hair, wears an evening gown with a corsage of orchids. The piano music, louder with the opening of the door, continues through all of the following. The pianist is hammering out "I Don't Want To Set The World On Fire" (or a similar hit of 1941).
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Greetings, Mrs. Kipfer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KIPPER (CORDIALLY) Why, it's Angelo Maggio. He barges past her through the door. Mrs. Kipfer frowns and follows him. Prew shrugs and goes in after her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Prew enters behind Mrs. Kipfer. The vestibule has an old South feeling of mustiness and respectability. Maggio is handing some bills to ANNETTE, a young, brash-looking girl, who sits behind a reception desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay... so there y'are. Dues all paid up. Who ya got playin the piana -- a hippo?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KIPPER Angelo, I don't believe I've met your friend. And you know how I hate to find you boys in this condition...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There. You see. Any time women see a soldier, think he's drunk. Why? You know why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because he is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KIPPER Heavy drinking simply doesn't mix with the entertainment business. Every respectable place must consider its future.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mrs. Kipfer, ma'am, I give you my solemn word your future will be safe with us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Maggio nods vigorously in agreement, then pushes through the heavy curtains which separate the vestibule from the room beyond. Mrs. Kipfer looks after him a little unhappily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KIPPER Angelo is one of my favorites. Annette, dear, take care of this gentleman, will you, please? Mrs. Kipfer exits through the curtains. Annette takes a card from file, picks up pen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It'll be eight bucks, Babyface. Four for initiation fee, four for April dues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say, what do I get for it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (rattling it off) Members are entitled to all privileges of the club which includes dancing, snack bar, soft drink bar, and gentlemanly relaxation with the opposite gender so long as they are gentlemen and no hard liquor is permitted. (takes a breath) Got it? Prew grins, digs in his pocket for money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Several rooms branch off from this main one. There are about a dozen soldiers in civilian clothes -- and about a dozen hostesses. Several couples are dancing. The man at the piano is banging away, his music clashing cacophonically with a jukebox record from an adjoining room. CAMERA PANS as Mrs. Kipfer moves to and fro encouraging the men to enjoy themselves. The New Congress is a sort of primitive U.S.O., a place of well-worn merriment. It is not a house of prostitution but the girls look available for goosing... all but one we see at the end of the PAN. She sits alone on a couch. This is LORENE. There is an innocent, child-like look about her. Her hair is done demurely in a circular roll low on her neck. She is about twenty-four. She is reading a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . magazine, untouched by the din around her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: SERGEANT "FATSO" JUDSON pounding the piano as if he is trying to knock the keys out. He has an enormous head and a hogshead chest. He resembles Porky Pig. His dead eyes look like two beads of caviar spaced far apart on a great white plate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: NEAR CURTAINS TO VESTIBULE Maggio is attempting some serious dancing with SANDRA, a very tall girl. Fatso's furious tempo and tune keep drowning the langorous tango coming from the jukebox. Maggio keeps switching his style as he tries to get out of the range of the piano but cannot. He is very annoyed. He and Sandra dance out of shot, as Prew and Annette enter from the vestibule.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: S them to a trio of girls on a couch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Girls, here's some new poison. This is Billy and Jean and Nancy. The girls smile, ad-lib hellos. Prew is looking over the girls' heads at someone in rear of room out of shot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: LORENE FROM PREW'S POV As if she senses someone is staring at her, she looks up from the magazine, smiles serenely across the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: FEATURING PREW AND ANNETTE as she reacts sourly to Prew's reaction to Lorene. He seems transfixed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't tell me the Princess is your style. Annette takes his arm, moves him toward two quite good- looking girls talking to a soldier.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meet Suzanne and Roxanne. The girls greet him heartily but Prew is looking back over his shoulder at Lorene. Annette plucks his sleeve with haughty disdain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Much as I adore your company, you must allow me to tear myself away. I see a few friends at the door. (SNAPS) Also I can see I will be of no use to you much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She walks off. The other girls resume talking to the soldier. Prew continues to gaze across the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: LORENE smiling back. Her head tilts up slowly as if someone is coming toward her. Prew comes into shot and stands before her, tongue-tied. She pats the couch. Her voice is low- pitched, poised.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you like to sit down?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh... sure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm Lorene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (enchanted by the name) Lorene...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I haven't seen you in here before. Prew gestures with the membership card.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I dint know about this place till now. A friend of mine brought me. We're stationed at Schofield.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. Somehow I didn't think you were a soldier.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (bridles a bit) Well, I am. And I'm in for the whole ride. I'm a thirty-year man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I suppose it's different when a fellow is going to make a career of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There ain't anythin wrong with a soljer that ain't wrong with everyone else. Lorene smiles her fatal smile at Prew's seriousness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I like you just the same. I liked you the minute I saw Annette bringing you in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me, too. I mean when I came in. I saw you over here -- There is a commotion across the room. A group of man and girls are surrounding the piano. Fatso has stopped playing and a shouting argument is going on between him and Maggio. Prew looks over, concerned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll play loud as I want, ya little Wop! A babble of voices drowns out Maggio's reply.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Friend of mine. (RISES) You wait right here for me, will ya?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Surely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: AT PIANO where two men are holding Fatso and three girls are restraining Maggio. The others are amused by the quarrel, but Fatso and Maggio are deadly serious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mess with me, Fatstuff, I'll pull you apart!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're the kind of character I eat for breakfast, ya little -- Maggio breaks away from the girls and rushes toward Patso but Prew, stepping through the group, grabs him. Mrs. Kipfer bustles into the melee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KIPFER Now, you gentlemen know I will not have any of this sort of thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up, you Wop, he says to me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Little Mussolini here tryin to tell me what way to play the piano.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, my ear drums fit to bust already with that noise!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KIPFER You man can simply leave if you're not going to behave yourselves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, Angelo, come on -- MAGGIO -- Ony my friends can call me Wop -- MEDIUM SHOT AT SIDE OF ROOM where Prew hauls Maggio away from the piano.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (has been watching) You know who that guy is, buddy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure, I know who he is. Whadda I care?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who is he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fatso Judson. Sergeant of the Guard at the Post Stockade.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: FATSO JUDSON settling down at the piano again. He glances over in direction of Maggio with a mean smile. Then he starts to hammer the keys viciously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MAGGIO PEW SOLDIER as the music starts, Maggio stiffens, turns as if to go back. Prew holds tight, to his arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm tellin you, leave him be. Nets danger. I seen him nearly murder a guy once. He likes it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Sandra comes over, disengages Prew's arm from Maggio's, puts her own around him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, bully boy, now you won the war, let's dance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (beginning to quiet down) First I got to calm my nerves. Come on with me to a phone booth or some thin. (slaps himself on belly) Where I will unveil this fifth of whisky I got under this loose flowing sports shirt. He and Sandra start off toward an adjoining room. Prew smiles, turns back toward Lorene. The smile fades.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lorene is looking at another soldier, on the couch beside her, with her rapt, innocent expression.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as he crosses room to Lorene, hurt and disappointed. CAMERA HOLDS on MEDIUM SHOT as he comes up to her and the soldier, a talkative man named BILL.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: you go along as fast as forty miles per through that surf and your balance has got to be letter perfect.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, I thought you were gonna wait.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (looks up, smiles) Bill here was telling me about surfboarding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, friend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sit down and just listen. He describes it thrillingly. Prew sits down, disgruntled. Bill notes his expression.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know anything about surfboarding?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Nothing. Not a thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You must be stationed inland then. I'm at DeRussey so I get lots of chances.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah? But then we got mountains. You know anything about mountain climbing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A little bit. Are you a mountain climber?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. You know anything about flying an airplane? Lorene is frowning now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've had a few lessons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I can't fly either. What do you know about deep sea diving?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you want to move into another room, Bill?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. The air in here seems to have gotten very smelly, hasn't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I noticed that, too -- BILL Listen, fellow -- LORENE Shall we go, then?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She and Bill rise. She smiles tremulously at him as she takes his arm and they start off. She throws a severe glance over her shoulder at Prew.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PREW He settles lower in the couch, the picture of frustration and hopelessness. He pulls a cigarette from his pocket and lights it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PARK BENCH Karen sits on the bench, her ankles crosses primly, very ill at ease. There is Payday activity here also; amorous strolling couples; men in ones and twos looking for pickups. Several unattached men pass Karen, ogle her. She is about to get up and leave when Warden comes into shot, stands over her. His civilian suit is neat and well-cut. Both are strained, awkward, antagonistic. Now that the step has been taken they are not at all sure it was a clever one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why, hello. I didn't think you were coming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not? I'm not late.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I guess you're not. But then I came a little early. I must have been overanxious. You weren't overanxious though, were you? You got here right on the dot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe I'd of been early too only I stopped to get a drink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You certainly chose a savory spot for our meeting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you rather it'd been the cocktail lounge of the Royal?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, but I've had five chances to be picked up in the last few minutes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sits beside her on the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's par for the course around here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I don't care for it. I never went in much for back-alley loving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Didn't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You probably think I'm a tramp, don't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What makes you think I'd think that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't try to be gallant, Sergeant. If you think this is a mistake, come right out and say so.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, what started all this, anyway? Why'm I shakin inside like a school kid out with teacher! Where'd I come up with a yen for of all things the Compny Commander's wife! And her actin like Lady Astor's horse all because I only got here on time! Warden's burst shatters the tension. Karen breaks into laughter. After a moment, Warden joins in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the other hand, I've got a bathing suit under my dress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Funny. I got one in a U-Drive-It parked around the corner. He takes her hand. They rise and walk away, backs to camera. They merge with the other couples in the little park.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: COUCH Fatso's piano music o.s. Prew is slumped on the couch. He stubs out the cigarette, which is almost burnt down. He sees someone coming toward him, slowly raises his eyes. Lorene comes into shot, looks down at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's the surfboard rider?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was a terrible way to have acted. What you did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was jealous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a funny one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you dames want? To take the heart out of a man and tie it up in barbed wire?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (angry because she really
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, look here, what do you think Mrs. Kipfer pays us for? We're hired to be nice to all the boys. They're all alike. Is it so important?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, it's important. Maybe we seem all alike but none of us is ever all alike. (PAUSE) All right, I'm sorry about before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (touched by his outburst) That piano is about to drive me out of my mind. Let's go up to Mrs. Kipfer's suite and sit there. She lets us use it sometimes... for somebody special.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you mad?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I'm not mad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because if you're still mad I'd just rather we called the whole thing off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (takes his arm) You certainly are a funny one. They walk away from camera, merging with the others in-the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: WAVE sweeping over camera, spray flying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A tiny beach set among rocks. The pale sand glows in the moonlight. Warden, in a bathing suit, is lighting a fire about ten yards from the water's edge. Karen is just stepping out of her dress; her bathing suit is underneath. A couple of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: blankets near the fire. Her teeth are beginning to chatter in the chill of the night air; she raises her arms to the sky longingly, happily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hope the ocean's ice cold. I hope I freeze in a solid chunk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sudden, intense laugh) Just so long's you melt afterwards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love the way you laugh. He stands, moves to her. She laughs, turns and runs into the water. He runs after her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: WAVE near shore, as Karen dives into it. Warden follows her. The wave washes over them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KIPFER'S LIVING ROOM - NIGHT 51.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DIVAN
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: D so we see only back of the divan. We hear soft chuckles from Prew and Lorene o.s., then silence for several moments. CAMERA MOVES as we hear a few more low, intimate laughs, then Prew and Lorene are disclosed on the couch, their heads close together as if they have just kissed pleasantly but not passionately. Mrs. Kipfer's living room is on the order of the vestibule; it, too, has a faded lavender feeling. A door leading to another room is half open in b.g. A door leading to a hall is closed. Prew's arm is around Lorene's shoulder; he is very relaxed, regards her with something like wonder. Lorene is mellower, too, making no effort now to be "the Princess." She speaks as if resuming a conversation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... I enlisted, too. I came out here on my own. To get away from my home town. In Oregon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How come?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had a boy friend. I was a waitress. He was from the richest family in town. He just married the girl suitable for his position. After three years of going around with me. (PAUSE) It's a pretty story, isn't it? Maybe they could make a movie of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They did. Ten thousand of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lorene smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So I left and went to Seattle, as a waitress. And I met a girl just back from Hawaii. She said she'd made a lot of money working for Mrs. Kipfer. I caught the first boat. I've been here a year and two months.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You like it much?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I don't like it. But I don't mind it. Anyway, I won't be here forever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Sure not. I mean, why should you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have it all figured out. In another year I'll be back home, with a pile of bills big enough to choke a steer. And then I will be all set for life -- There is a sound at the door and they turn towards it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DOOR TO HALL as it opens slowly and a disembodied arm pokes through, its hand gripping the neck of a whisky bottle. After a moment, Maggio's head follows the arm through the door. He is grinning like an amateur conspirator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I dint hear no sounds of combat. So I figgered maybe you'd like a drink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Maggio comes into the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or otherwise old Sandra would of drank it all by herself. She's a fine girl. But she drinks like a fish. There are glasses on a cupboard near the divan. Maggio sets three of them up, starts to pour whisky into them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, thanks. I never drink much. Maggio stops short of the third glass. He takes a big gulp from the first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think it' a a weakness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I grant you that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I don't like weakness. (TO PREW) ) Do you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I don't like weakness. (rises, takes a drink) But I like to drink. He comes back to the divan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With you it's not a weakness. With you it's more like a virtue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That sounds like a very profound remark. Maybe that's why I don't get it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (snuggles to Prew) Well, it's so.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey! What you gonna do, marry this guy? Way you grinnin at him you look like his wife!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get outa here!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (picks up bottle) Okay. Back to old long-legged Sandra. I love 'em tall. Acres and acres. He goes out, closing door behind him. Suddenly the door opens again and Maggio pops back in. He puts the whisky bottle on a table next to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Enjoy yourself, pizon. You need it more than me. You be back with The Treatment tomorrow. He pops out again, the door closing after him. Prew's gaiety dims with the reference to The Treatment. Lorene sees this. Prew rises, goes to whisky bottle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was nice before. The way you snuggled up. In front of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's he mean, The Treatment? Prew doesn't answer. He pours a drink, gulps it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did he mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some of the guys puttin me over the jumps because I won't fight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fight?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the boxing team. I don't want to fight! I don't want to talk about it! I don't want to think about it. And they make me think about it. Every day. He drops down on the divan beside her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a personal thing... His dread of telling the tale crumbles before his overwhelming need to tell it, to have someone understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Over at Port Shafter... I used to fight... Middleweight. I was pretty good. I used to work out with Dixie Wells. He was a light-heavy, but he was fast... And good. He loved boxing. He was gonna come out of the Army and go right into the upper brackets... People on the Outside had their eye on him. (rises, paces) Dixie didn't want, to use the six ounce gloves this time. And we neither of us wore headgear, anyway. I was set flat on my feet when I caught Dixie wide with this no more than ordinary solid cross. Dixie just happened to be standing solid, too. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sits on chair) From the way he fell I knew. Dead weight, square on his face. He dint roll over. He was in a coma a week. Then he finally came out of it. The only thing was that he was blind... (rises, paces) I went up to the hospital to see him. Twice. Then I couldn't go back. We got to talking about fighting the second time. And Dixie cried... Seein tears comin out of those eyes that couldn't see... There are tears on Prew's face. He turns away from Lorene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: SHOOTING FROM BEHIND PREW Lorene, very moved, goes to him, stands behind him, puts her hand on his shoulder. Prew does not turn but his hand grasps hers. CAMERA MOVES TO CLOSE SHOT of the hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: NEAR SHORE A wave sweeps by camera, Karen and Warden riding it into shore. CAMERA PANS with them as they walk out of the water, hand in hand. They stop at edge, as if by a mutual impulse. He swings her to him and kisses her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as they kiss. The embrace is impassioned. When their lips separate, their arms remain around each other, holding tight to something they find is more than sex alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Karen and Warden kiss again, a tenderness in him not seen before and which he normally takes great pains to hide.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as their lips separate again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody ever kissed me that way... not really... They are both disquieted by the quality of their reactions to the kisses. The jump to banter is a quick defense.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: them as they walk to the fire. Karen smiles at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Nobody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not even one? Out of all the many men you've been kissed by?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, that will take some figuring. How many men do you think there've been?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as they sit, beside the fire. Karen wraps one of the blankets around her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wouldn't know. Can't you even make me a rough estimate?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not without an adding machine. Do you have your adding machine with you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I forgot to bring it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then I guess you won't find out, will you?
direction.name: direction
