direction.raw_text: BARRACKS WINDOWS ON UPPER FLOORS The windows are crowded with men watching the fight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: OUT WINDOW To FRONT OF BARRACKS SHOOTING OVER heads of men watching, out to Prew and Galovitch on the ground. Dispassionate, professional ad-libs from the men: why does Prew continue his attack to the body only, a good little man and a good big man, etc.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: WARDEN AND HOLMES FEATURING WARDEN Warden is at his desk filling out an application blank. Holmes is glancing over his shoulder..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : OFFICER EXTENSION COURSE APPLICATION BLANK Warden's hand in shot filling out answers to sex, age, race, etc.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be glad to recommend you, Warden. You've got service, experience, grade. You'll make an excellent officer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Holmes waits for thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, sir. The screen door in the Orderly Room bangs. Thornhill runs into the office, breathless. He comes to a shaking attention as he sees Holmes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At ease, Sergeant. What's the matter?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They fightin on the green, sir! Galovitch and Prewitt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ike looks like `e goin to murder him, sir. A pleased look crosses Holmes' face. Warden jumps up, starts for door. Holmes catches his arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no rush. I'll take care of it. Holmes goes out. Thornhill follows, turns at the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ain't you want to see it, First?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! I ain't want to see it! Nor you either! Get out of here! Thornhill goes. The screen door in the Orderly Room bangs. Warden walks to his desk, stares down at the application form, picks it up. He carries it over to Holmes' desk. He looks at the picture of Karen on the desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PHOTOGRAPH OF KAREN MEDIUM CLOSE SHOT WARDEN He stares at the picture, then looks at the application blank. Then he looks down at the chevrons on his arm. He rubs his hand over the chevrons gently, fondly. He looks at the application blank again very thoughtfully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PREW AND GALOVITCH ON LAWN A continuation of the fight. Prew is tiring, his face is cut and bleeding and there is a welt under one eye. Galovitch is unmarked but grunting now from Prew's constant jabs at his stomach. He seems perplexed, as before, by his opponent+s tactics.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: SPECTATORS
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the non-"ath-a-leets" of G Company, including Anderson, Clark and Treadwell. Ad-libbed shouts of "In the face, Prew! In the face!"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: FEATURING the "ath-a-loots," including Dhom, Wilson and Henderson. They are watching quietly, nodding with approval as Prew feints, then darts several punches into Galovitch's ribs, It almost seems as if they are admiring Prew's courage, inwardly rooting for him. Holmes enters the group, Thornhill tagging after him. Holmes stops and watches the fight. There is a look of satisfaction on his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PREW AND GALOVITCH The fight continuing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: near rear of crowd. An officer, walking across the lawn, is attracted by the noise. He steps into the crowd. This is
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He wears the insignia of the Inspector General's Department. He watches the fight, is about to step through to break it up when he sees Holmes. He stops, watches Holmes' reactions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PREW AND GALOVITCH Prew, backed up against the crowd, trips over somebody's feet. He falls without being hit. Galovitch kicks at him and Prew rolls away. The crowd murmurs angrily. Sergeant Stark steps out into the open circle, faces Galovitch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This ain't no rassle, Ike. You got to fight this man fair. Approving shouts from the crowd. Stark steps back. Ike waits for Prew to get up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PREW looking up at Galovitch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: GALOVITCH SHOOTING UP FROM PREW'S POV CLOSEUP GALOVITCH'S EYES CLOSEUP PREW His eyes narrow, harden as if his inner struggle has been resolved.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PREW AND GALOVITCH Prew gets to his feet. As Galovitch comes to him, Prew feints for the stomach, then throws a hard right to Galovitch's face. It hits him flush on the nose. Blood spurts. The crowd roars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Galovitch, surprised and hurt, throws up his hands. Prew drives both fists to his solar plexus. Galovitch drops his guard. Prew smashes him in the face and Adam's apple. Galovitch falls to his knees, hawking and choking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PREW AND GALOVITCH The whole nature of the fight has changed. Galovitch, hurt and reeling, rushes Prew, bull-like, head down, defense wide open. Prew dodges easily, slamming hard with rights and lefts to the head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holmes, seeing Prew is now clearly in command, steps out of the crowd and up to the two fighters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right. Let's cut it. There is a look of relief on the faces of both Galovitch and Prew as they stop fighting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What started this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Prewitt talk back to non-com. Refuse order I give him, start fight. I teach him lesson. A laugh from the crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You won't disobey any more orders in my Company, Prewitt. Warden saved you from a court martial once but he won't this time -- Anderson steps into the circle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir -- I'm sorry, sir but Private Prewitt's not to blame for this. Sergeant Galovitch started it. Holmes reacts, momentarily at a loss. He turns to Thornhill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thornhill, you're in charge of this detail. How about it? Thornhill steps into the circle, nods toward Anderson.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: `e's right, sir. (points to Galovitch) `e begun it. Prewitt done nothin. From the crowd step Sergeants Dhom, Wilson and Henderson. They face Holmes and Galovitch implacably.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, sir, this wasn't Prewitt's fault.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right, sir. Everybody knows Galovitch started it. Wilson nods. There is a murmur of agreement from the crowd. Holmes looks at his fighters, rocked by this betrayal. They stare back at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: COLONEL WILLIAMS Still near the rear of the crowd, he watches the scene with much interest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holmes pulls himself together, turns to the crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's all. Break it off. Let's get back to our jobs. (to Prew and Galovitch;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm giving you two a break. I'll ignore this. He walks off. He does not see Colonel Williams. Galovitch moves off toward the barracks. Wilson, Henderson and Thornhill remain grouped around Prew.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You guys figure this means I'm steppin into a ring, you're wrong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's your show, kid. Run it the way you want.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You better put same iodine on them cuts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. An come over to Choy's tonight. We buy you a beer. The non-coms walk off, Prew stares after them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ACROSS ROAD PREW CLARK ANDERSON Sounds of gaiety from the beerhouse mingle with the mournful twang of guitars being played by Clark and Anderson. CAMERA MOVES SLOWLY toward the trio until the beerhouse noises are
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . low. The men are surrounded by many empty beer bottles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Woke up sick on Thursday Feelin like my head took a dare Looked down at my trousers All my pockets was bare That girl sure was bad news Re-enlistment Blues... The guitars finish the stanza with a flourish as CAMERA HOLDS on MEDIUM SHOT. The men chuckle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some day I'm goin back to Scranton and play it for my folks. And tell em it wan composed in the Hawaiian Islands! Clear across the Pacific Ocean!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (finishes long swig of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Friday.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why you called Friday?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't know. I was borned on Wednesday. (plucks guitar, sings) Went back around on Friday Asked for a free glass of beer... The three laugh, sing in unison.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My friends had disappeared Barman said, `Take off, no credit here'...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: NEAR ENTRANCE TO CHOY'S The music from across the road almost lost in the laughter and shouts from the beerhouse. Warden comes out, wobbles a bit. He has One On. He cups his hand over his ear, straining to hear the singing. He stumbles into Choate, coming along the sidewalk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Top, you sure plastered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am off duty. Off duty if I want to get plastered -- But Choate has gone into Choy's. CAMERA RETREATS with Warden as he wanders to the road, still trying to locate the singing. Half-way across the road he unceremoniously sits down, crosses his knees Buddha-wise. Here the singing is more audible. He listens contentedly.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: ANDERSON CLARK PREW, ANDERSON AND CLARK, (SINGING)

direction.raw_text: PREW ANDERSON CLARK PREW, ANDERSON AND CLARK (SINGING) Ain't no time to lose Re-enlistment Blues... Anderson, as usual, finishes the stanza with a brilliant display on the guitar. Prew stands up. In the glow of a streetlight his face shows the marks of his battle with Galovitch. He wobbles and we realize he, too, really Has One On.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where you go in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Back to Choy's. Get nother drink. The guitars and singing continues in b.g. through following.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: S with Prew as he weaves to the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MIDDLE OF ROAD as Prew crosses. He can see the seated figure but the light from the street is too dim to identify it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Halt! Prew stops automatically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who goes there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A friend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Advance, friend, and be reconized. Prew moves closer, CAMERA WITH him, until he recognizes Warden.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (roaring, laughing) Quiet! At ease! Fall out! Right dress! `bout face! Hit the track! Garbage Detail! Latrine Detail! Dis a drill, not picnic! Hello, kid. Whatever you doin out all by yourself?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm goin to get a drink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Siddown. I got a bottle. He pulls a bottle of whisky from his field jacket, holds it up to Prew. Prew takes the bottle and drinks. Then he sits down in the road as matter-of-factly as did Warden. He gives the bottle back to Warden.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hand it to you, kid. They called off The Treatment this afternoon. When you beat up Ike. I never heard of no soljer before ever lickin The Treatment... (drinks; then holds out
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here, old buddy. Have a lil drink. Prew drinks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is a terrible crummy life, you know it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miserble. Perfeckly miserble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What if a truck or somethin was to come along and run over us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Awful. Awful. We'd be dead, wouldn't we?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An nobody to even mourn. You better not sit here any more. You better get up and move over to the side of the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about you? You got more to live for than me. You got to take care of your Compny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm old. Don't matter if I die. But your life's ahead of you. You get up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, sir. Never deserted a friend in need. I'll stay to the bitter end.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shakes head stubbornly) We'll stay together. They square their shoulders heroically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (as if to an invisible
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No blindfold. Save it to wipe your nose on, you skunk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amen. Each takes a drink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Prew, I got the biggest troubles in the whole world.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The whole world?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take love. Did you personally ever see any of this love? Prew nods gravely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll unerstan, then... This girl, see, she wants me to become.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Become what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (after long hesitation) An officer. Can you see me as an officer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure I can see it. You'd make a good officer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You both can see more'n I can. You know what, Prew? I'm scared become an officer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You ain't scared of nothin, Warden.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I am. I tell myself diffrnt but it's a fack. Where'd I be as an officer? How could I handle him? That's the one thing I'm scared of... be an officer in the U.S. Army. (HASTILY) Army of the U.S.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A man should be what he can do. Warden nods solemnly as if Prew has uttered a great truth. They pass the bottle once more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's your girl? Wha'st that name again?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lorene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, yeah, I remember. Lorene. Beautiful name.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Warden claps Prew on the shoulder as if he is a lifelong friend. They smile. They look as if they are sharing a great secret, a secret known to them alone in the world. The mournful guitars and singing comes over a little louder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The headlights of a jeep descend upon Warden and Prew. Then the vehicle skids into the shot with a screeching of brakes, comes to a halt directly in front of the men. Warden and Prew look at the car calmly, don't move. The headlights are blazing on them. Stark hops out from the driver's seat, furious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatsa matter with you, you crazy, dumb screwballs?! You tryin to get killed?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What you doin with that jeep, Sergeant Stark?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I borrowed it. I'm goin to town. What you doin in the middle of the road? The music of the guitars has stopped. There is a strange whine now, far in the distance, not identifiable. It grows during following.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My friend Prew and I sittin here discussin the weather.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your friend, huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You beard me. I said my buddy Warden. My good friend Warden that you better not run over is what I said.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: WARDEN
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you know you got to look out for this man. Get him off the road before you run him over. He's the best stinkin soljer in the Compny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You both must be plumb nuts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You heard me. Get this man to some safety. Why, he's the best stinkin soljer in the Compny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess I'm the one who's nuts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MAGGIO as he stumbles around the side of the jeep directly into the blaze of the headlights. There are scars, new and healing on Maggio's face. One of his ears is cauliflowered, enough to give him the lopsided ribald look of a punchy. A couple of teeth are missing. Weirdly outlined in the glare, he is a nightmare figure, an apparition. The whine in the distance is identifiable now. It is the siren of the Stockade.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... figgered you might be at Choy's...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The men gape at Maggio, unable to accept the shock of his appearance. Then Prew and Warden jump up and catch him as he is about to fall. The drunkenness drains out of them. Stark watches in bewilderment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (spewing words out) ... done it like I said... e- scape... e-scape like I figgered... Under a tarp inna back of a truck from the Motor Pool they rode me right out just like I figgered like I said... Ony the tailgate came down 'bout a mile back... an I fell inns road... (GIGGLES) ... shoulda seen me bounce... musta broke somethin... (clutches Prew's shirt) Prew... lissen...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Angelo... Warden steps back as Prew holds Maggio. During following Anderson and Clark come over, watch pop-eyed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fatso... Fatso done it to me... yestiday he did it for keeps... He likes to whack me in the gut with a hoe handle an then he asks `that hurt?' and then I spit at him... Ony yestiday he done it ten times runnin an somethin bust... you know, like they was a fish swiminin aroun inside you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, let's get him to the hospital. Maggio grasps him tighter. He is crying now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Prew... they gonna send you to the Stockade...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Angelo -- TWO SHOT MAGGIO AND PREW MAGGIO (PLEADING) Should they do, watch out for Fatso! You gotta make like it's a game... He'll try to crack you but you ain't gonna crack... He's gonna see you but he'll never see you saw... `n' when he puts you in the Hole you just lay there `n' be still... `at's the ony way -- be still... `n' remember things... but not people. Not people! Things like nature... woods you been in... trees is awys good... He goes limp in Prew's arms, slides to the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Warden bends over Maggio. The others watch, scared.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PREW staring down at Maggio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Warden looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dead? But he was here just a minute ago. Prew bends over, picks up Maggio, holds him in his arms gently, unbelieving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fatso's lucky. They'll figure he got killed fallin out of that truck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He ain't dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of Prew as he carries Maggio to the jeep, the others following. He lifts Maggio into the rear of,the jeep. Warden puts his hand on Prew's arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's dead, Prew. Prew stares at Maggio, lying in the jeep. Stark gets into the front of the jeep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll take him, Prew. He starts the motor. Prew leans over, moves Maggio's body a little.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See his head don't bump. The jeep drives off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Framed beautifully in the moonlight, the Quadrangle and Barracks area look like a college campus. Silence. No movement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ANOTHER ANGLE A figure can be seen far in b.g, at the Bugler's post beside the megaphone. Another figure stands near him. The silence continues, then is broken by the sound of the bugle beginning
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Taps. The first note is incredibly clear and loud and certain. It is held longer than most Buglers hold it. The second note is daringly short, abrupt. The last note of the first phrase rises, peals out, heartfelt. Two men come into the shot, smoking. They stop, turn toward the Bugler, listen attentively. One of them flips away his cigarette. The Taps continues through the following.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Most of the men turn in their beds toward the sound of the bugle. Some prop up on their elbows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: CHOATE as he listens. A look of mingled longing and satisfaction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: LEVA listening. A strange look of pride.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MAZZIOLI listening, his face also betraying emotions normally concealed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: TREADWELL AND ANDERSON listening. Their bunks are next to each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a reverent whisper) I bet you it's Prewitt...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three men come out of the barracks, lean over the porch rail, listening. Their faces are thoughtful, sad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: WARDEN The office lit only by a light over his desk. He is working late, a sheaf of papers spread out before him. He listens to the bugle call, moved, sorrowful. He snaps off the light, listens in the darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PREW at the Bugler's post. He is finishing the last phrases, full and wonderful. Behind him stands Friday Clark, motionless. The final note quivers to silence. Prew swings the megaphone for the repeat. Then the repeat begins, the clear proud notes reverberating across the silent quadrangle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: KARELSEN lying on his back in his bunk, arms clasped behind his head. He listens, his gnarled face the picture of the old soldier. He breathes heavily as if he is hearing his own requiem and epitaph.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are eight or nine men here now, listening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: S DHOM HENDERSON THORNHILL There is a choked kinship on all the faces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: More men are propped on their elbows, their heads turned toward the Bugler. The dim figure of Treadwell can be seen, at a window now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (almost inaudible whisper) ... I told you it was Prewitt...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PREW continuing the Taps. There are tears in his eyes now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A half dozen men are sitting on the steps, listening, among them Stark and Wilson. Stark shakes his head sadly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: WARDEN listening now on the porch alongside the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Several groups of two and three scattered about. They are standing in no particular places, as if they have been walking and stopped suddenly. They are all looking toward the Bugler.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ANDERSON as the Taps repeat is drawing to a close. He is lying on his side, turned toward the Bugler, a look of serenity, of peace on his face. His eyes close as he falls asleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PREW coming to the end of the Taps. CAMERA MOVES IN to a CLOSEUP. Prew's face is wet with tears. His lips are pinched and red. He blows the final notes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PREW AND CLARK Prew lowers the bugle slowly and lets the megaphone rest in its swivel. He withdraws the mouthpiece, puts it in his pocket. He hands the bugle to Clark. Clark looks at the instrument as if it has become hallowed. Prew walks off into the darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: CAMERA MOVES along street, passing a lone pedestrian. It
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the sign NEW CONGRESS CLUB, HOLDS beside an open window through which is heard the sound of harsh piano playing; the pounding style and lack of shading are clearly Fatso Judson's. CAMERA PANS AND INCLUDES Prew, leaning against the building. He is watching the entrance to the Club patiently. There is relentless hatred on his face. The music stops. Prew does not move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: AT ENTRANCE Hearty male laughter from within. The door opens and Fatso and a couple of sailors cane out. They are about to start down the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Fatso. Fatso looks around in direction of voice. CAMERA PANS,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Prew, still leaning against the building. Fatso squints, not recognizing him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, Fatso. Fatso takes a couple of steps toward Prew, squints again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't like that nickname. You want to see me about somethin?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Let's step around the corner here where we can talk. Prew's voice is so toneless as to be ominous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Good night, gents. The sailors go off. Fatso walks into the darkness of an alley next to the building. Prew follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PREW AND FATSO Just enough light from the street lamp to illuminate about ten feet into the alley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. You sore about somethin?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I just don't like the way you play the piano. Fatso throws back his head and laughs loudly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know Maggio?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The little Wop? The one who bust out of the Stockade? Sure. He was a real tough monkey. But crazy, see?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You killed him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did I? If I did, he ask for it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hear they're gonna court martial you, Fatso. But before the Army gets you, I want a piece of you myself. There is the snick of a blade snapping open as Fatso pulls a knife. He moves toward Prew, who steps swiftly to one side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I kinds thought you'd try that. There is the same sound as Prew pulls a knife from his pocket, snaps it open, holds it out flat in his hand, showing it to Fatso.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This here's the one you pulled on Maggio once. Reconize it? Fatso darts at Prew, knife raised. Prew moves back, but Fatso is on him and they both roll to one side along the building. The movement throws them deep into the shadows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: SHOOTING INTO THE SHADOWS The two figures feint and dart. There is the occasional silver flash of the knives as light hits them. The men go deeper into the shadows, are all but lost to view. There is a startled, pained cry. Then one of the figures falls to his knees and starts to crawl toward camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: SHOOTING NEAR GROUND as the figure comes directly to camera, REVEALING the anguished face of Fatso. It slowly turns, is upside down in the frame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fatso is on his back, his stomach gushing bloods his eyes already glazing. Prew staggers into the light now. His left side has two vicious cuts; he is bleeding badly. He stares down at Fatso, who manages a small, reproving voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've killed me. Why'd you want to kill me? Prew backs away from Fatso, turns, staggers down the alley away from camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Prew comes toward camera, laboriously struggling up the road. His side is hemorrhaging steadily, his shirt and trousers blood-soaked. He stops close to camera. He wads his handkerchief, sticks it inside his shirt near the knife wound. He smiles wearily, crookedly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (mumbles to himself) Gonna have an awful bad scar there... He lights a cigarette, his fingers shaking. The flame from the match illuminates his left wrist. There is a deep scar on it. It seems to fascinate Prew as he stares at it, rubs his fingers across it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... scars... He turns, moves on up the road; CAMERA MOVES CLOSE behind him, as if overhearing his thoughts which come over on sound track.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) ... got that one fallin off the barn back home... gashed it on a spike... Dad laughed... Dead now... Uncle John+s dead, too... Prew moves away from camera out of shot.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: SECTION OF THE ROAD CAMERA FOLLOWS

direction.raw_text: ANOTHER SECTION OF THE ROAD CAMERA FOLLOWS Prew, as he keeps in shadows, moves slowly up the cliff. He is in much pain now. His hand rubs across his face; his fingers linger on his forehead near his eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) ... that cut over the eye... in the ring at Myer... wouldn't let `em stop it... knocked the guy out... sixth round...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Prew again as he stumbles into shadows.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: OF PREVIOUS PREW-ALMA SCENE CAMERA FOLLOWS

direction.raw_text: SITE OF PREVIOUS PREW-ALMA SCENE CAMERA FOLLOWS Prew, who is now fighting hard to keep his feet. His hand is pressed tight to his side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) ... ten stitch gash in the hip... workin in the gym attic... fell through the skylight... where was that?... so many scars... so many years... where they all gone to anyway...? He moves on around bend in road out of shot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ALMA AND GORGETTE The radio is blaring the "Hut Sut Song." Alma is crocheting. Gorgette is reading. CAMERA SHOOTS across them to the front door. The doorknob moves slowly, the door opens. Prew falls into the room and pitches to the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She rushes to him, bends over him. Gorgette runs to the radio, turns it off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ALMA Her face agonized as she leans over Prew.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Prew!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ALMA AND PREW He pushes himself up on one elbow, seems pleased by her stricken expression. He manages a smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry... Ain't gonna die. They savin me for better things... Gorgette kneels into shot. Prew's smile becomes silly as he turns his head to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... just came up to borrow a good book.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: GENERAL SLATER COLONEL WILLIAMS HOLMES The American flag, the General's flag and the Division flag are the only colorful elements in a rather severe office. Colonel Williams is reading from a typed report.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In addition to inefficiency in administering his command and neglect of duty, Captain Holmes has been guilty of indefensible cruelty to the aforesaid Private Prewitt. This extended to instigating and encouraging wholly unauthorized and discreditable tactics to force the soldier to join the inter-regiment boxing team. These findings are the result of personal investigation by the Inspector General and are corroborated by numerous members of G Company. Colonel Williams puts his report on the General's desk. Holmes' face reflects a weary resignation as if underneath he has really expected something like this for a long time. He makes no move to speak. The General is angry clear through.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm waiting for your reply to this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I haven't any, sir... The charges -- are true.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holmes, the first thing I ever learned in the Army was that an officer takes care of his men. It seems to be the first thing you forgot. It's monstrous to think of anybody like you in command of troops. And believe me, you won't be for long. My only regret is that we have to keep you in uniform until a court martial is concluded. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) In the meantime, of course, I'm relieving you of your present duties. He indicates the meeting is over. Holmes rises, is about to leave, pauses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If there were any way to avoid a court martial, sir. Any way... The General frowns, is unresponsive. Holmes looks to Colonel Williams helplessly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is one alternative, General... if you're so disposed. A resignation for the good of the service under AR 600-275.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (thinks a moment) I'll give you a chance you don't deserve, Holmes. Write a letter of resignation and have it on my desk this afternoon. I'll consider accepting it. Only because as far as I'm concerned, the quicker you're out of the Army the better for everybody. Especially the Army.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: KAREN AND HOLMES He confronts her, waving a sheet of stationery. His voice is strangled, almost hysterical.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: that's right, it's a letter of resignations I'm through! I've already been relieved! So you can begin packing. We're sailing for the States next week! She shakes her head, not wanting to believe; she takes the letter out of his hand, starts to read it. She stops after a sentence or two. Her hand falls to her side. Holmes sits on the bed heavily. The bluster bleeds out of him. He shakes his head, emotionally bewildered. For perhaps the first time in his life he is nakedly honest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where has it gone, Karen? What happened to it? The gay, cheerful life we were going to have, you and I...? What happened to me...? The proud, dashing officer was going to be. The leader of men?... I've known all along how the men felt about me. They despised me... What's happened? I don't remember losing anything... Where has it all gone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: KAREN reacting; she is surprised, a little afraid of her own emotion. The outcry, so lost, so despairing, moves her. She is sorry for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: HOLMES AND KAREN HOLMES Karen -- you're coming back with me, aren't you...? Trembling, Karen puts the letter on the dressing table. Abruptly, she runs out of the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DESK
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: placard reading LIEUTENANT ROSS. We hear Ross' first few words over this, then CAMERA PULLS BACK to MEDIUM SHOT. Ross is forceful, clean-cut, gives the impression of toughness but fairness. As he talks he takes down the photographs of prize fighters and prize fighting from the wall. Watching and listening are Sergeants Dhom, Thornhill, Henderson, Leva, Stark and Karelsen and Corporal Wilson. Ross is such a complete switch from Holmes that the men are almost unnerved by him. But a definite respect is reflected in their expressions. Warden, beside his desk, shares this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't intend to have a sloppy outfit. I don't intend to have a goldbrick outfit. I don't intend to have a soft soap outfit. I've called you noncoms in because you're the backbone of any Company. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From now on you'll have to prove you're entitled to have those stripes here. And not in the boxing ring. He bands the pictures to Leva.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get rid of these, Sergeant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's all I have to say. If you've any questions, speak up. Nobody speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dismissed. The men troop out, passing camera. As last man leaves, CAMERA IS ON Warden. He is looking at Ross with considerable approval, even admiration. He resumes a more normal expression as Ross turns toward him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One non-com was missing, sir. Sergeant Galovitch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. Private Galovitch is in the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the kitchen?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As of now, he's an assistant cook. I busted him. On a blanket charge of inefficiency. What are you grinning at?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think the Company Commander made a wise decision, sir. The phone rings. Warden goes to his desk, answers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Compny G, First Sergeant Warden speaking. Karen's voice is heard on the phone; we cannot understand what she is saying, but a flood of words pours through. With Ross looking on, Warden is embarrassed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes... Yes, I know... (glances over toward Ross) Yes, the - uh - parcel has already arrived... Yes... What?... (GRIM NOW) No. No, we'll have to talk about it soon. Right away. I - I don't know... Ross perceives Warden's distress. He starts toward the door. Warden nods gratefully. Ross smiles, leaves the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lissen, I'll get away somehow, tonight. I'll meet you in Kuhio Park. At eight... Right.... He puts down the receiver. He stares at the desk. Then he slowly pulls out the top drawer. The Officers Application Blank is lying on top of a pile of other papers. He takes it out, looks at it somberly. CAMERA MOVES IN to an INSERT of the Application. We see Warden's answers to sex, age, race, etc. CAMERA MOVES DOWN the page to the place for the signature of the applicant. It is unsigned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In b.g. Warden, in uniform, and Karen are sitting on the same bench as in their first meeting in the park. We cannot hear what they are saying at first. CAMERA MOVES IN past a few pedestrians and HOLDS on a MEDIUM SHOT. There is a defeated, tired look about them, as if they have been talking for a long time to no avail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... I guess I felt it that night I asked you to become an officer. When you didn't say yes right away. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess I knew deep down you wouldn't do it. But -- (a hint of tears) It seemed such a simple plan for us...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wanted to -- I tried -- but I couldn't... He runs his hand through his hair. He seems to be groping inside himself for some way to explain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lissen -- there's a kid in our outfit named Prewitt... Robert E. Lee Prewitt... He came in from the States about a year ago. I thought he was a fresh punk at first... until I got to know him a little. He's AWOL right now -- probly in some kind of real trouble -- he ain't the kind to go AWOL otherwise. Anyway, I keep remembering somethin he said to me the first day he came in. He said a man has got to go his own way... if he don't, he's nothin... I'm an Enlisted Man. I'm a First Sergeant. Milt Warden. Once I cross that line and tried to be an officer, I'm somebody I don't know. A stranger. And a man has got to be what he is...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess that's the trouble with Dana... He's always tried to be something he isn't. Poor Dana... I don't think he ever needed me until now. (shaken herself out of it) Well, here we are saying goodbye. And talking about two other people.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not saying good-bye -- we'll figger out a way for you to stay
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going back with him, Milt. There's something in being needed. It isn't love. But it's something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lissen, two people who love each other just don't stop loving each other! Nothin and nobody is goin to break us up l 1111 transfer out somehow and get back to the States. Maybe it'll take a little time but I'll do it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That sounds like Milt Warden, all right. He bends toward her to kiss her. She presses him back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Milt. I don't want to kiss you any more. I just want to remember you. And you to remember me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put it down. Put it down that on December 6th, 1941, Milton Anthony Warden told you he'd remember you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a few pedestrians, Warden and Karen remaining in b.g. of shot. They begin to talk again, quietly, undemonstratively. We are too far away now to hear what they are saying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PREW AND ALMA Alma is reading a newspaper in b.g. Prew is disheveled and slovenly, needs a shave badly. His face is lined with pain. He is drunk from several days of steady drinking, stone drunk, as if in a trance. He wears crumpled civilian clothes. He is at a table laboriously writing out the Re-enlistment Blues. He finishes writing a stanza and sings softly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Slep in the park that Sunday Seen all the folks gain to church Your belly feel so empty When you're left in the lurch -- Alma looks up from the paper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here it is -- they're putting it on an inside page already. (READS) `... still no clue in the fatal stabbing of Staff Sergeant James R. Judson...' Prew, who has stopped singing but not turned his head, resumes the song.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dog soljers don't own pews Re-enlistment Blues...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you hear me? Are you listening or not? Prew nods blankly. He rises slowly and walks across the room toward Alma. But his eyes are fixed on a whisky bottle on a table beside her. He moves stiffly, favoring his side, his face contorted. He picks up the bottle, pours himself a drink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you trying to set a new world's record?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PREW He smiles faintly, holds the glass high.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah... To the memory of Robert E. Lee Prewitt, Holder of the New World's Record...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PREW AND ALMA ALMA I want to know what you plan to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Plan to do? When?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Any time. Now. Tomorrow. Next week.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lessee... (counts on fingers) (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... One... two... three... four... Four days I'm AWOL, ain't I? (picks up paper, looks at
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... this is December sixth, ain't it...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (half-tirade, half-wail) It's December sixth and you're so drunk you're wall-eyed. And all you've done since you fell in here is drink and drink and drink and try to remember that old song of yours. And I want to know what you're going to do! Prew looks at her, hurt. He moves back to his table, mumbling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... might ship out on a tramp and go to Mexico and be a cowboy...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, be sensible! Prew sits at the table again, continues to mumble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... I'm goin back to the Compny... soon's my side heals... Goin back under my own power... Goin into the Ordrly Room 'n' say hello, Warden, Private Prewitt reportin...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Prew! Prew! Why did you have to do it? Why did you have to kill that man? Prew shakes his head sadly as if he doesn't know the answer. He picks up the paper he has been writing on, sings softly, testing the last couple of lines affectionately.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Recruitin crews give me the blues Old Re-enlistment Blues...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: CAMERA FEATURES clock on wall reading 7:52. About half the Company is at breakfast. There is considerable laughter and horseplay. Near the kitchen a dozen men are in the chow line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: FEATURING Warden at the NCO table. He rises, carries his plate with him towards the chow line. A sudden, deep-toned, earthquake-like blast shudders through the room. The cups on the tables rattle. Warden stops, cocks his head. The men stop eating, look at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to the room) Must be dynamitin down to Wheeler Field.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Them engineers mighty ambitious Sunday mornin before eight o'clock. The men resume eating. Warden moves a couple of steps toward the chow line when the second blast hits. It is much heavier and fuller.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: WARDEN He has a hunch about this now. He reaches out to put his plate down, holding it very carefully in both hands. However, he doesn't bother to see if there is anything under it. The plate falls and crashes on the floor a fraction of a second before the third groundswell of blast shakes the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: NEAR MESS HALL A man sprints toward the mess hall, yelling to right and left at the top of his lungs. As he approaches camera we see it is Mazzioli.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Japs're bombing Wheeler Field! It's the Japs! They're bombing Wheeler Field! The Japs! It's the Japs! I saw the red circles on the wings!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: SHOOTING UP CIRCLES ON UNDERSIDE OF MOVING PLANE The roar of the plane over shot.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: DOWN FROM JAP PLANE PAST PILOT

direction.raw_text: SHOOTING DOWN FROM JAP PLANE PAST PILOT The figure of Mazzioli gets closer and closer as the plane
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . dives toward him, machine guns spitting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MAZZIOLI as the Jap plane flashes by close above him. The stones in the pavement pop up. Mazzioli flops on the street. The plane zooms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MESS HALL as the men rush out. In the front ranks are Warden, Karelsen, Stark and Choate, Choate carries his half-filled plate in one hand, a mug of coffee in the other. The men stretch their necks, following the plane. Then they look back up the street, CAMERA PANNING. Far in b.g, a column of black mushrooming to the sky. Warden dashes to Mazzioli. CAMERA MOVES IN to a CLOSE SHOT as Warden bends over him, hoists him to a sitting position. He is extremely gentle. Mazzioli's knee is laid open and is bleeding freely. Warden whips out a handkerchief and starts to apply a tourniquet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some of the men continue to crane at the sky. A few pick up metal links from the Jap bullets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say! This'll make me a good souvenir! A bullet from a Jap plane!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This ain't jawbone! This is for record. Theme real bullets that guy was usin. Get inside -- all of ya! Warden gets Mazzioli to his feet, turns to first man in group surrounding them. It is Anderson.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help him over to the hospital. Anderson starts Mazzioli down the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: SHOOTING UP TO SKY A pair of planes are diving toward the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The men rush for cover, all except Choate who is left alone in shot. He takes a big bite of his sausage and eggs, hastily downs a swig of coffee. Then he throws the plate and cup into the street and dives for cover as the terrifyingly loud noise of the Jap planes indicates they are directly overhead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The men are pouring in from the Company street, all shouting at once. Warden pushes his way through them and jumps up on the pool table. His big voice booms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, all right, you men! Quiet down! Quiet down! It's only a war. Ain't you ever been in a war before? The men begin to quiet down, look to Warden respectfully. Through the scene the heavy earth shudders are felt and heard as bombs hit in the far distance. Also the sound of the strafing planes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're gonna organize a fire umbrella defense. I want the non- coms to get BARs and ammunition from the Supply Room and get up on the roof. Henderson, you're in charge of the loading detail. Get movin! The non-coms push out the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, what about me? I been waitin all my life to git to shoot a BAR at somethin!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. It's your life. Treadwell hurries after the non-coms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The rest of you guys - the CQ will unlock the rifle racks. Every man get his rifle and go to his bunk and stay there. And I mean stay there! I'm making each squad leader responsible to keep his men inside. If you have to use a rifle butt to do it, that's okay, too. There are shouts of protest. The men are over the first shock now and beginning to get angry, anxious for action.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You heard me! This ain't no maneuvers. You go runnin around outside you'll get your ears shot off. You want to be heroes, you'll get plenty chances later. You'll probly have Japs in your laps before night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What if they bomb us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You hear a bomb comin, you're free to take off for the brush. But don't worry -- the Japs'll probly drop all their bombs on Pearl Harbor and Hickam. They ain't gonna waste `em on us. So let's can the chatter. We're wastin time. Squad leaders, get `em upstairs! Squad leaders begin to herd their men out. Warden jumps off the pool table. Stark and Karelsen come up to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What you want me to do, First? I got a hangover, but I can still -- WARDEN You stick in the kitchen and make a big pot of coffee. No -- make a barrel of coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I could get one of them Japs with a machine gun, Milt. We'll put the tripod over a chimney. And hold her down by the legs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatever you say, Pete. They smile at each other affectionately, then push into the crowd leaving the Day Room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The non-coma are arguing violently with Leva at the door to the Supply Room. Jap planes are loud overhead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't care. I can't issue any live ammunition without a signed order from an officer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But there ain't no officers yet, you jerk! Lieutenant Ross lives off the post.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry fellows. Lieutenant Ross give me them orders himself. No signed order, no ammo. And that's all they are to it. Warden hurries up to the group.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He won't let us have no ammo, Top!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hats got it locked up. An the keys in his pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gimme them keys!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't, Top. I got to obey my orders. No live ammo without a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They flatten against the wall as a Jap plane roars building- high down the street, machine guns flaring. After it passes, they rush back to Lava,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the matter? You blind? You see them planes --?! Lava puts his hand in his pocket protectively, shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I ain't gonna do it, Top. I -- WARDEN Okay. Chief, bust the door down. (TO LEVA) Get the hell out of the way!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Choate, Henderson and Dhom back up for a run at the door. Leva moves in front of the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go ahead. Bust it down. He'll get out of the way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Remember I warned you. I did my best.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. I'll see you get a medal. Warden dashes up the porch steps as Choate, Henderson and Dhom launch themselves at the door. Leva steps aside. The door rattles ponderously, then flies open. The three battering rams careen into the Supply Room. The men standing by cheer and rush in after them. Leva shakes his head grimly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The men are sitting on their bunks, unhappily, holding their rifles. Others who have slept through breakfast are dressing hastily. Warden rushes into the room. The men immediately bark ad-libbed questions at him:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the deal, First? Why can't we go up on the roof? Where's the ammo, Top? Are we soljers -- or Boy Scouts?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Start rollin full field packs! We may have to move out of here. Squad leaders, get `em packin! In b.g. Henderson and others are going up the porch stairs to the roof. They tote BARs and loading clips. Karelsen and two helpers follow with a heavy machine gun and belt boxes. Warden starts for the porch stairs. He is attracted by something, stops, looks out of scene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: THORNHILL FROM WARDEN'S POV lying under an empty bunk with three mattresses piled on it. He is in his underwear and a helmet, hugs his rifle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: THORNHILL AND WARDEN 144.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll catch a cold, Turp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't go out there, First Sergeant! You'll be killed! They're shootin it up! You'll be dead! You'll not be alive any more. Don't go out there!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You better put your pants on. Warden hits the floor as a plane is heard so loud and low it sounds as if it's coming right into the room. A dotted line of bullets crosses the floor and moves into Warden's and Karelsen's room. Warden jumps up and rushes into the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Warden runs in. Broken glass lies all over the floor. Bullet holes are stitched across the top of Warden's footlocker. He throws back the lid fiercely. His linen is polka-dotted with holes. He tosses out shirts, shorts, etc., digs underneath them. He pulls out a quart bottle of whisky; it is untouched. Warden smiles with relief. He lifts the bottle to his lips, drinks long and heartily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ROOF About twenty of Company GIs men, including almost all the non- cams, are on the roof, They are crouched behind the chimneys or down on their knees in the corners. The BARs are propped on the low walls or chimney tops, their muzzles pointed to the sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: SHOOTING FROM ROOF TO SKY Three Jap planes, forming a V, are heading straight for camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MEN ON ROOF DHOM (SHOUTING) Come on, you dirty sons -- The scream of the planes drowns Dhom's voice. There is a tremendous clatter as the men fire. The Jap planes pass, untouched.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . From this moment on there is no letup of the noise -- there is a wild cacophony of Jap planes, BARs, Karelsen's machine gun, the deep sound of bombs hitting in the far distance. And Chief Choate, singing the Regimental marching song, loudly and lustily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Warden comes up on the roof through the skylight. He shouts incoherently at the men. They shout back in a wild cheer. They are like a pack of hungry men enjoying their first big meal in years. In b.g. the Jap V has swung about and heads back. Warden grabs a BAR from the roof.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: FLASH JAP PILOT IN LEAD PLANE grinning as his plane dives, its guns roaring. His silk scarf ripples out behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: WARDEN firing the BAR, standing, as the Jap planes roar over. He staggers back from the recoil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ROOF The men fire in unison. They rise after the planes pass, shake their fists. Henderson and others of the loading detail appear on the roof, bringing up more ammunition.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: FEATURING WARDEN He lets out a hoarse yell of glee and pride. "These are my boys. This is my Company," it seems to say. The men answer back with a great answering shout.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Warden makes a tour of the roof, laughing, exhorting, slapping the men on their buttocks like a quarterback. They respond with tremendous spirit; they are having one hell of a time. We get only a snatch of what Warden is yelling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry about wasting ammo! Throw your empty clips down into the yard. The loading detail will pick 'em up -- The sound of a bugle blowing insistently is now heard, blending into the rest of the noise. Treadwell runs to the edge of the roof, looks over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: SHOOTING FROM ROOF TO QUADRANGLE At the Bugler's post, Friday Clark is sounding a call.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Treadwell turns, yells at the men.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Friday's gone crazy! He's blowing the Cavalry Charge!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: CLARK His cheeks puffed, blowing the bugle madly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PREW He is lying on a couch in pajamas. He has not shaven, his hair is unkempt. A Radio Announcer is heard over shot. Prew wakens, groggy with hangover and near-delirium, wrestles with the blanket over him. CAMERA PULLS BACK to MEDIUM SHOT,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alma and Gorgette. They have negligees over their nightgowns, are listening to the radio. The Announcer's voice tries hard to be calm and official but he cannot keep the tremor out of it. (NOTE: Transcripts of the actual broadcast have been requested.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... This is a real attack, not a maneuver. The Japanese are bombing Pearl Harbor. Please keep in your homes. Do not go on the streets. I repeat, this is a real attack. Japanese planes are bombing our naval and army installations. Civilians will remain in their homes. This is a real attack - The Announcer's voice goes on as above.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, those dirty Germans... Those dirty sneakin Germans...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What Germans?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (points to the radio) Them...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's the Japs. The Japs!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Attacks are now taking place at Pearl, Wheeler, Hickam and Schofield...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... dirty Germans... Alma shakes Prew, hard. He falls back on the couch, passes out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Jap strafing attack is continuing. Their planes are making a figure 8 in the sky. Silhouettes of men on the roof can b e seen. Friday Clark is blowing his Cavalry Charge. In b.g. men of the loading detail are scurrying around. Lieutenant Ross runs into shot. CAMERA PANS him across the quadrangle toward the barracks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: NEAR BARRACKS Lieutenant Ross is hailed by the loading detail -- about ten men. He grabs a BAR and ammunition from them and runs into the barracks. The loading detail is working feverishly, same carrying ammunition into the barracks, others picking up empty clips as they are thrown from the roof and hustling them toward the Supply Room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: FEATURING LEVA He is working hard, passing out ammunition to members of the loading detail. But he shakes his head dourly as if the whole thing is still very unofficial.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As before, pandemonium -- but controlled and efficient. The men are hoarse from shouting, red-eyed, puffing from excitement and exertion. Two Jap planes swoop past and the full-throated umbrella of fire lets loose. Lieutenant Ross clambers onto the roof, stooping under the burden of the BAR and loading clips. The men greet him with a concerted cheer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: LIEUTENANT ROSS AND WARDEN Ross looks around the roof, nods with evident approval, claps Warden on the shoulder.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: DHOM'S VOICE HERE THEY COME, MEN

direction.raw_text: . Sound of Jap planes comes up ear-splitting loud. Ross drops down behind a chimney, swings his BAR, fires. CAMERA MOVES TO INCLUDE Karelsen at the other side of the chimney, firing the machine gun. Two soldiers hang onto the bucking legs of the tripod. Two Jap planes pass in b.g. of shot, zoom off into the sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nuts! Led him too tar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as the men on the roof reload. In the distance the Jap planes have turned and are heading back for the roof.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: S FLASHES JAP PILOTS IN PLANES Their lips curled bitterly as their planes head for the roof.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: FLASH WILSON firing a BAR at the planes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: FLASH DHOM firing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: FLASH TREADWELL firing Joyously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: FLASH CHOATE singing as he fires.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: KARELSEN firing the machine gun. He yanks the tripod away from his helpers, picks up the gun, stands and swings it after the plane. The recoil staggers him half way across the roof and deposits him on his rear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: JAP PILOT He jumps in his seat like a man tied to a hot stove, throws up his arms helplessly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: OPEN FIELD SHOOTING FROM ROOF The Jap plane bursts into flame and crashes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The men rise as one with an uproarious cheer. They rush to Karelsen, pick him up. Warden lets go with another of his rebel yells.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got him, Pete! You got him!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (spits over roof) Ah, nobody'll ever know which of us got that guy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as the men return to their positions. Two planes head for them, pass over as Company G lets go again with everything it has.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pointing after second of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey! That last one was one of ours! That was an American plane!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, he ain't got no business here. We're takin care of this sector!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: swooping across the quadrangle about ten feet from the ground.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: SHOT SHOOTING FROM ROOF JAP PLANE

direction.raw_text: NEAR BUGLER'S POST Friday Clark, blowing the Cavalry Charge madly, abandons the megaphone as he sees the plane coming. He drops on his chest, hugging the bugle. The plane passes. Clark jumps up instantly, resumes blowing the Charge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: SHOOTING FROM ROOF JAP PLANE The same plane has gained altitude so that it is a few feet above the barracks as it heads straight for the roof.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The men flatten, all but Warden. He stands, swings his BAR toward the plane. CAMERA IS ANGLED so that Warden is silhouetted against the sky as he fires at the Jap plane.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: JAP PLANE It misses the roof by a foot or two, zooms up at a weird angle. A thick cloud of smoke pours out of the engine. The plane falls off on one wing and crashes into trees at the end of the quadrangle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: JAP PLANE crashing. The gas-tank explodes. A cloud of fire and black
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . smoke obscures the screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PREW There are improvised blackout curtains over windows and the glass doors. The radio is on, volume low, and an announcer (not the one of the morning) is droning out an account of Pearl Harbor. Prew, still on the couch in his pajamas, looks as if he has just struggled to wakefulness. He listens to the radio for a few moments in confused disbelief. He shakes his head vigorously as if to throw off his grogginess. He shakes his head again, slowly, more knowingly now, nodding as if he remembers something from the broadcast of the morning. Then as if all of it hits him suddenly and fully and terribly he wrenches himself off the couch. He looks around at the dimly lit room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alma! Alma! He goes to the blackout curtains, peeps out. Then he turns back to listen to the radio. Abruptly, he runs into the bedroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alma! The room remains empty for a few moments as the radio announcer goes on, continuing previous remarks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ready to fight and die for us, our Regular Army and Navy have this day upheld the faith and confidence we have always placed in them. They have proved their right to the esteem we have always had for them... Prew comes back into the room. He has his shoes on, holds civilian shirt and pants in his hand. He starts to put them on hurriedly, his attention still focused on the broadcast. The front door opens and Alma and Gorgette enter. They are surprised to see Prew up.
